text: When you today start a new App which targets Android 4+, do you still use Fragments from the v4 support lib, or the „native“ ones?
(good morning)
i am still using it with v4.
even in 4+
sometimes i feel it doesn't create mess and i am clear about it.
ok :smile:
support
always, because I used Fragments in a project and it wrecked me when it came to nesting
Yeah I just noticed child fragments are only available since API 17
Currently setting up a completely new project from scratch… Considering the AS templates still use deprecated stuff (e.g. the drawer indicator) I ripped out everything
It’s gonna be fun, the other dev has never used AS before, also he and the architect never used git, so I’ll give them an introduction tomorrow :confused:
oh man oh man
how is he architect if he never used git?
some other vcs I assume?
SVN has been the leading vcs here for ages...
my work is done for today
here everyone is on git
hahah
We can select now when we create a project. SVN or git. We use FusionForge for all that
never heard of fusionforge before
I feel like I’m „over-normalizing“ my database
Hello together, does anyone know how to change the color from the keyboards search / submit button when using the searchview in the actionbar?
<@U04TK850N>: I would refuse to work with someone not using Git.
(That is for a new project)
Who even uses the AS templates?
some of the templates are pretty useful :wink:
fucking beacons god damn it i don’t wanna work with them ever again
why
range seems so random. sometimes phone gets the signal, sometimes not. testing them is a pain in the ass
^ I had the same experience
outside of knowing if one is nearby, they where useless. You could kinda tell if they where near or far but it wasn't very reliable
it also doesn't help that the devices can only establish a limited number of connections which is problematic
<@U06BJPFD0|mramsden> has joined the channel
plain sucks
We lost a beacon in the office… Kept triggering the apps for weeks >.<
:joy:
man I’m pissed, I detected it 3 times, then fourth nothing, like it ain’t even here
and they’re all scattered around the office
The best thing I found was that having so many beacons in close proximity would break my bluetooth mouse and headphones
how? :O
I think it was bluetooth interference. When I moved the beacons away my headphones worked again
Glad that project is over :stuck_out_tongue:
you know, now with three beacon projects and multiple BT devices all around me… that might be causing the problems I’m having :smile:
Ugh, don’t get me started on Beacons
the ranging is so unreliable
I have about 40 bluetooth devices in my office
we have not experience connectivity issues
I have a meeting, now, laters :confused:
not doing audio streaming though just serial connections
later alligator
its also worth mentioning the changes they made in android M have made me stop hating bluetooth

it now seems to do magical things like not take 5 minutes to connect to my stereo. If I get out of range and come back it doesn't garble the hell out of the audio quality until I disable/enable bluetooth anymore
and no more random disconnects
I usually didn’t experience random disconnects, everything worked smoothly
must be nice, with my car stereo I had the exact same problems on my N4, N5, and N6
M fixed my N6 though
so how much of M is working atm
pretty much all of it
the clock though sucks
M == “L - the working edition"
dismiss is broken and their's a hilarious bug where snoozing an alarm for say 10 minutes ends up snoozing it for 24 hours
i like the sound of the latter
lol
M was buggy as shit on my N9
would not flash to your daily driver
flashed it on my nexus5
:sunglasses:
<@U053TJ508|garrettbt> uploaded a file: <https://androidchat.slack.com/files/garrettbt/F06BPCH62/screenshot_2015-06-15-10-17-17.png|Slack for Android Upload>
<@U054MT9FC> what library did u use for the color picker
Its a modified version of the one by Flavian Laurent
So do you have a bunch of different themes in styles.XML that you just switch to when a color is chosen or what's your general set up? I want to be able add different themes/colors to my app.

I don't
If you notice, when you change themes in my app, its all animated and happens dynamically. You can't get that with styles
Also I have nearly 200 colors, so writing a style for each one would be torture
Everything is using a custom view and tinted programmatically
With my method I can just throw any rgb code at it, and it'll work
neat. So do you generate state lists for widgets too so you can slightly change the color for disabled/highlight/pressed?
any of those states just use black or white overlays/ripples, so it’s not overly complex
Interesting

I'm a little confused trying to implement IAP.  When Google says "Instead, you can construct the whole public license key string at runtime from substrings," does that mean just having a bunch of strings and then doing -  key = string1 + string2 + etc?
That would probably be optimized by the compiler. But ultimatley I wouldn't bother doing that, it's just security theatre like the TSA. Is this for an app or game.
just an app
its nothing huge, just a iap to remove ads

I wouldn't worry about it then. If you really want to <http://stackoverflow.com/questions/13101727/obfuscation-hide-hardcoded-values-in-java> has some good ideas. The only things that would need it are pvp games, but those use server side verification of iap anyway

attachments.text: Possible Duplicate: hiding strings in Obfuscated code I'm trying to hide a little some static Strings of my app in order to make it harder to decompile, this way like the constants like ...
attachments.fallback: Obfuscation: hide hardcoded values in java

text: Also, if I'm checking to see if they made an IAP everytime they load the app, should i always connect to the play store to check? Or should i save the value to a shared preferences after they purchase it in case they don't have internet?
I do both. Trust the sharedprefs, then on each app open do the iabhelper query inventory and change sharedprefs as appropriate.
I did some obscure stuff with steganography before :smile:
Hiding an access key in an image
I have a Base64 string and an icon and would from that get my key. I know it's not secure, but it's obscure enough for the application

It basically goes: De-Base64 the string, split it on the '|', put those values in an array, reverse it, XOR it with a predefined mask and then read the byte values of the icon file at the indices given by the decoded string. Then convert those bytes to a String. That will be your key :smile:
god bless
This is why I 'reverse engineered' Fabric's Digits.
I wrote a generator for it so it's easy to generate new "secrets"
I needed the phone number and if someone gets the key, the whole login is down.
Fabric's Crashlytics still is in the app, but what do I care, I'll just reset it.
It's useless to put this in the app imo.
There are paid obfuscators, but I still didn't get around trying any: <https://dexprotector.com/>

attachments.title: DexProtector
attachments.text: Dexprotector features Dexprotector provides all the features you need for complete protection of your Android applications: Application encryption DexProtector uses a strong cryptographic algorithms to encrypt String data andDalvik bytecode.

text: is there anypoint in passing a "developer payload" string when performing an IAP?
We're using it to associate a userid on our servers with a google purchase, to make sure that when we validate the purchase we credit the correct user on our server with the coins they purchased

So if someone tries to redeem an iap with our servers but can't because the server's down or something, then they log into a different app account, when we query inventory we'll see they still have an unconsumed iap and try to redeem it, it won't because the purchase is associated with another userid
<@U04TK850N>: sounds like a solution to something that shouldn't be a problem. There are easy ways to prevent this.
This isn't secure, this is only making it harder.
It's like md5'ing a password instead of storing it in cleartext.
<@U053Q5XP2>: Is it necessary though
that's one use case. If you can't think of a reason to put one in, it's not neccesary
You can put in username or user id just to make customer service easier if you want
If i leave it blank, will they still have the non consumable iap if they login from a different device with the same google account?
yes
ok cool
thanks
the developer payload is for the benefit of the developer. Google will function the same regardless
<@U061HDV96>: I'm fully aware. It is always a consideration between what you need and what time you want to invest
hey dont know if you guys know this but you can sign up for Google's Cloud Test Lab in the developer console
how does that work tho? My app needs to log in with a username and password for any of the activities to work.
Mine is with sms verification.
I signed up, mentioned that too ^
Is enabling regular ads in alpha testing allowed
what are you guys’ thoughts on the space widget? Can it replace layout_margins?
or is layout_margin faster than inflating the space widget
im sure that is situational
its also pretty handy if you want to make a custom layout and don't want to bother writing the padding/margin code
I always just use View though
is Android File Transfer broken for anyone else after upgrading to M?
nope works fine here
<@U054MT9FC>: you need to click on the notification for charging
then you can enable the transfer type
ahhhh
sweet
thanks
that worked
its a long overdue security fix that your data isn't immediately available to anything you plug into
yeah it's a really cool feature
<@U055GGAHS>:  Hey.
